About UsZenly started in 2011 as a small team of passionate designers, engineers, and entrepreneurs gathered around the idea that frictionless location sharing is the next mobile commodity. Our R&D has brought us to release the best location sharing app in the world
column4: )And now, Zenly is the mobile application that lets you instantaneously seewhatyour friends areup to.We believe that making maps more social and personalised is our opportunity to improve the way people live, communicate and share moments together. Our product empowers people to find themselves, enjoy improvised moments and have fun together.RoleWe are looking for a full-time Data Analyst to join the growth team based in Paris, France.As part of the Growth Team, you will work with a highly-motivated, cross-functional team of product designers, data analysts and engineers to help optimize the app through continuous experimentations. You will take part in the full cycle of an experiment by conducting analyses to help generate data-driven hypotheses, define the experiments, measure and report the results.Zenly has a huge dataset with billions of diverse events generated per day.ResponsibilitiesParticipate in the design, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of experimentsConduct advanced quantitative analysis on large and complex data sets to understand the product and identify growth opportunitiesCreate testing strategies(e.g.A/B testing) to optimize the time-to-insights for growth experimentsDesign and implement dashboards to monitor the relevant metrics and get valuable learningsPerform in-depth analysis on experimental and observational data to understand user behavior, interpret the findings and communicate the learnings to the rest of the organizationDevelop new statistical approaches, experimentation methodologies to improve the growth cycle/processRequirements3+ years minimum experience working with large data sets and turning complex data into actionable insightsExperience with A/B test principles and methodologies for controlled experimentsStrong knowledge of SQL to manipulate and analyze relational databasesAbility to translate data into easy-to-understand reportsPerformance driven and willing to take action quicklySelf-motivated and energetic team player with a strong work ethic and cooperative attitudeIf you do not meet all the requirements but you are eager to learn, do not hesitate to apply.PerksOur office in the Bastille area is built on 3 floors around a green atrium. It has a fully equipped kitchen, rest areas, and sound isolation booths. We also put up a climbing wall between 2 floors and a massive trampoline :)Everyone at Zenly is offered a great package including:Competitive salary andRSUsInternational phone allowanceGym membership allowance100% coverage of your health insurance: for you, your partner, and your family100% coverage of your public transportation titleFun: Trips abroad every year with the whole team(Siciliain 2018)Pet-friendly officesYoga classesFree drinks and snacks of all kinds(homemadepastry, fruits, etc.)Flexible time off policyHandling of relocation/visa procedureApplyingWe are more interested in your experiences, projects, past and current, than your rÃ©sumÃ©. We'd rather hear about these and what you think you'll bring to the team. All applications should be made in English

Le contenu du poste est libellÃ© en anglais car il nÃ©cessite de nombreuses interactions avec nos filiales Ã  lâinternational, l'anglais Ã©tant la langue de travail.Sanofi is looking for an experiencedCyber Security Operations Center (SOC) analyst. This is an opportunity to work in a state of the art SOC with cutting edge cyber security technologies and work alongside other experienced and knowledgeable experts. Sanofi takes cyber security very seriously and ensures that SOC analysts are provided the right tools and training to be able to respond to unexpected and complex attack strategies. This is a great opportunity to expand your knowledge, experience and career. The Sanofi SOC is global and responsible to monitor, detect and respond to any possible cyber attack.The SOC analyst needs to be an expert in cyber security. He/She must have expertise in forensics across various operating systems and technologies. He/She is responsible for developing new detection and response capabilities. The SOC analyst will be a highly competent computer scientist, capable of improving existing processes and technologies and developing brand new strategies and technologies. The SOC analyst must also be knowledgeable and respectful of all relevant legal and compliance requirements. The goal is to ensure that Sanofi has highly competent cyber security experts to lead and puzzle out any attacks we might face.The SOC analyst will ensure that appropriate forensics information is gathered from each incident engagement. Root cause analysis will be completed to ensure we learn from each incident and improve our detection and protection capabilities. The SOC analyst is the expert who can identify security gaps, missing controls and detection strategies. The Analyst ensures risk reduction by developing rapid response strategies, expanding protection capabilities and improving the time to remediation so that dangerous security situations are quickly and effectively resolved.Profile:Formal Education and Experience Required:University/Masterâs Degree in Computer Science, preferably in Information Security.Real world SOC or forensics experience.Computer Programming skills, especially in Python.10 years of professional experience in IS/IT, of which 5 years is in IS/IT Security.Security Certifications like CISSP or CEH.Expertise and Competencies:The candidate should have significant expertise in common operating systems like Windows, MAC and Linux. As a SOC analyst, expertise in understanding how these systems can be attacked, defended and forensically investigated in important. Basic understanding of computer networks, firewalls, intrusion prevention technologies, and Antivirus technologies is necessary. Real world experience working with these technologies is expected. Expertise as a red team penetration tester or a blue team system defender would be preferred. Candidates should also have some experience with Security Information Event Management (SIEM) systems and Event Detection and Response (EDR) technology.Basic scripting skills in Python, Powershell and Visual Basic would be expected. More advanced programming skills are not required but would add strongly to the profile.Leadership and strong communication skills are required to lead small teams in times of crises and to provide efficient communications around risk and threat levels. A good ability to translate complex technical stories into non-technical language is necessary. Candidates should also be capable of determining the confidentiality level of topics and ensuring that confidential data is treated appropriately and not leaked or exposed. Candidates should work well with others and have strong listening skills.Candidates should have experience working globally across cultures and organizational levels. They should be aware and have working knowledge of international privacy and regulatory requirements for industry in general and for the Pharmaceutical industry specifically.Finally, the SOC analyst should be able to function with a high level of autonomy. They should be willing to take on responsibility, take initiative and ensure tasks are completed efficiently and thoroughly. They should be appropriately assertive and ensure strong rigor in how they treat each subject.Mastery of English is required.Sanofi is committed to welcoming and integrating people with disabilities.At Sanofi diversity and inclusion is foundational to how we operate and embedded in our Core Values. We recognize to truly tap into the richness diversity brings we must lead with inclusion and have a workplace where those differences can thrive and be leveraged to empower the lives of our colleagues, patients and customers. We respect and celebrate the diversity of our people, their backgrounds and experiences and provide equal opportunity for all.As part of its diversity commitment, Sanofi is welcoming and integrating people with disabilities.

Position DescriptionOUR WORLD IS A WORLD OF CHANGEHere at Volvo Group we are driven by the idea that through imagination and technological innovation we will lead the way towards developing a world that is cleaner, smarter and more connected. Analytics is a driving force supporting this ambition. We believe in a sustainable future and with the global transportation industry as our arena, we work together with our customers to turn this belief into reality for people everywhere. That is our purpose, and we live and breathe it, every day.Do you want to be a part of building the world we want to live in? Do you love finding patterns in data? Are you innovative and enjoy working with cutting edge technologies with an eye on customer needs and business opportunities?Are you passionate about how analytics can be utilized to improve customer satisfaction and quality performance?Then Data Scientist at Quality & Customer Satisfaction is the job for you!THIS IS US, YOUR NEW COLLEAGUESThe Innovation & Data Analytics team is responsible for setting the strategic roadmap for analytics methods as well as providing expert data analytics insights and advice to the business within the quality and warranty area. We support engineering functions in quality and warranty matters across Volvo Group Trucks Technology globally.We offer you to play a key role in our team, as an advanced analytics problem solver, able to go in on your own or as part of a larger team into a wide array of projects and application areas. You apply both your considerable Data Science skills and your business development skills to get the right project started and improvements implemented.Main Activities And ResponsibilitiesAs Data Scientist your main responsibility is to use your scientific knowledge and engineering skills to analyze large amounts of complex data, create models that can be applied to challenging problems, develop new algorithms and leverage machine learning techniques to address the needs of the Volvo Group. The aim is to create valuable insights and new business opportunities, and to communicate them effectively to colleagues and collaborators. You will work in diverse projects, closely together with teams across different parts of Volvo Group. The role requires an open mindset and the passion to deliver great results every time.You are an expert problem solver who apply analytics in our most challenging areas. You like complexity. You drive all phases of problem solving, from business understanding, data understanding, data structuring, data modeling, and giving recommendations to engineers and management teams.You support the solving of urgent quality issues and manage complex challenges in areas of data mining, optimization and data visualization.You are comfortable & passionate about starting & setting up new projects & investigations and are equally interested in discussing business value and implementation with managers as you are discussing technical problems & solutions with the engineers.WHO ARE YOU?You are a data scientist by training & experience but also comfortable in business transformation discussions. You have at least a five years of relevant work life experience and convincing success-stories that attest to your abilities. You are passionate about data driven problem solving and want to work with technical problems right now but you could see a manager or project manager career in front of you in a few yearsâ time and see this job as a stepping stone in that direction.You have a positive drive with a demonstrated ability to manage and coordinate cross functional projects, keeping a business mind set and customer orientation. You have the ability to adapt your communication to different stakeholders with different perspectives.You have broad experience in modern machine learning techniques and are able to build models independently in several different environments. Given the right data, you are able to build a data model that predicts what percentage of a vehicle population that is at high risk of failure within the next 12 months. You are also able to explain the results to colleagues and top management and put it into a Volvo context.Experience working as a Data Scientist in a consultative selling context is considered a merit.Required Experiences And EducationMaster of Science or equivalent in Engineering, Statistics, Appl. mathematics or Computer Sc.5 years' experience in the field of Data Analytics.Excellent communication skills in English, both spoken and writtenThe position will be based in Lyon, with regular travel expected to other Volvo Group engineering centers, primarily in Sweden but also US, India, Belgium and Poland.If you feel that you are the right person to take on this challenge then please send us your application!For Further Information, Please ContactDaniel Zackrisson, Manager Innovation & Data Analytics Services, +46 31 322 04 85About UsThe Volvo Group is one of the worldâs leading manufacturers of trucks, buses, construction equipment and marine and industrial engines under the leading brands Volvo, Renault Trucks, Mack, UD Trucks, Eicher, SDLG, Terex Trucks, Prevost, Nova Bus, UD Bus and Volvo Penta.Volvo Group Trucks Technologyprovides Volvo Group Trucks and Business Area's with state-of-the-art research, cutting-edge engineering, product planning and purchasing services, as well as aftermarket product support. With Volvo Group Trucks Technology you will be part of a global and diverse team of highly skilled professionals who work with passion, trust each other and embrace change to stay ahead. We make our customers win.Auto req ID101454BREntityGroup Trucks TechnologyState / ProvinceAuvergne-RhÃ´ne-AlpesCity/TownLyonEmployment/Assignment TypeRegularTravel Required (maximum)Occasional TravelFunctional AreaTechnologyLast application date12-Feb-2020

In a few wordsAs a Senior Data Analyst, you will be at the core of Contentsquareâs value creation and innovation. You will be working closely with our UX/UI Designers and Customer Success Managers on a variety of data analysis projects and you will also contribute to Product and AI development with our R&D team.In the Data Analyst team, our motto is âKeep Creatingâ. We ask every team member to constantly suggest ways to improve and challenge the status quo, in whichever way possible. Constant innovation is a key component of our DNA.The role of a Data Analyst is a hybrid one, mixing two very different sets of skills:Technical skills: Statistics, mathematical knowledge, advanced Excel-like tool knowledge, and data crunching âBig Dataâ databases in SQL.Consulting skills: The consulting skillset is harder to master, but involves being able to listen, understand and convince key decision-makers on the client side. Starting from raw data extraction, a Data Analyst will aim at transforming data into an appealing story, with simple and precise Data Visualisations, in an efficient and timely manner.On a typical day you might:Conduct website audits along with deep analysis for our clients in collaboration with the Customer Success Managers, UX Designers and UI Designers.Constantly suggest ways to improve our methodology or its application, and deliver projects based on these suggestions.Work in collaboration with âthe Labâ and the R&D team on AI development projects.What you'll need to succeed:2+ years experience in working with numbers and data (e.g. databases, Excel, statistics, data visualization)You are fluent in French & English (C1 level at least)Experience / skill in one of the following programming languages: SQL, Elastic Search, Python, R, or other data exploration language. If not, strong, evidence-based interest in learning technical skills.Knowledge of the digital ecosystem: business models, analytics, acquisition, ecommerce strategies.You are extremely motivated and excited to join Contentsquare adventure. You feel like working in a very ambitious team, within a rapidly growing company, matches your career goals.You strongly believe that continuous learning is a requirement for your next job. You are excited by innovation and quick change.You are a proactive team-player.Good to know:Start date: As soon as you're availableContract: CDILocation: We are located in the center of Paris, near la MadeleineAs well as the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business hereâs what else we offer:Plenty of opportunities for training and developmentFlexible approach to working hours and holidaysAttractive people care approach with good health insuranceFun office culture and strong team spirit, with beers every Friday and quarterly partiesRegular breakfasts and fruit in the office each week25 days PTO + 10 days RTTMany benefits via our CSE such as reductions on gym membership and leisure activitiesDoes this sound like it was written for you? You are very mindful about your application architecture, performance, testing and maintainability and its overall quality.Bonus PointsLarge-scale distributed systems, service oriented architecture.Previous experience with all or some of the elements of our Stack (we mainly use Scala, Spark, Breeze, Kafka, AWS, Jupyter notebooks).Experience in solving complex business related challenges.Knowledge of AB-testing and the related analysis.MySQL and NoSQL datastores.If you want to apply machine learning at scale and solve high scalability problems, join us!About TeadsTeads is The Global Media Platform. Position DescriptionOUR WORLD IS A WORLD OF CHANGEHere at Volvo Group we are driven by the idea that through imagination and technological innovation we will lead the way towards developing a world that is cleaner, smarter and more connected. Analytics is a driving force supporting this ambition. We believe in a sustainable future and with the global transportation industry as our arena, we work together with our customers to turn this belief into reality for people everywhere. That is our purpose, and we live and breathe it, every day.Do you want to be a part of building the world we want to live in? Do you love finding patterns in data? Are you innovative and enjoy working with cutting edge technologies with an eye on customer needs and business opportunities?Are you passionate about how analytics can be utilized to improve customer satisfaction and quality performance?Then Data Scientist at Quality & Customer Satisfaction is the job for you!THIS IS US, YOUR NEW COLLEAGUESThe Innovation & Data Analytics team is responsible for setting the strategic roadmap for analytics methods as well as providing expert data analytics insights and advice to the business within the quality and warranty area. We support engineering functions in quality and warranty matters across Volvo Group Trucks Technology globally.We offer you to play a key role in our team, as an advanced analytics problem solver, able to go in on your own or as part of a larger team into a wide array of projects and application areas. You apply both your considerable Data Science skills and your business development skills to get the right project started and improvements implemented.Main Activities And ResponsibilitiesAs Data Scientist your main responsibility is to use your scientific knowledge and engineering skills to analyze large amounts of complex data, create models that can be applied to challenging problems, develop new algorithms and leverage machine learning techniques to address the needs of the Volvo Group. The aim is to create valuable insights and new business opportunities, and to communicate them effectively to colleagues and collaborators. You will work in diverse projects, closely together with teams across different parts of Volvo Group. The role requires an open mindset and the passion to deliver great results every time.You are an expert problem solver who apply analytics in our most challenging areas. You like complexity. You drive all phases of problem solving, from business understanding, data understanding, data structuring, data modeling, and giving recommendations to engineers and management teams.You support the solving of urgent quality issues and manage complex challenges in areas of data mining, optimization and data visualization.You are comfortable & passionate about starting & setting up new projects & investigations and are equally interested in discussing business value and implementation with managers as you are discussing technical problems & solutions with the engineers.WHO ARE YOU?You are a data scientist by training & experience but also comfortable in business transformation discussions. You have at least a five years of relevant work life experience and convincing success-stories that attest to your abilities. You are passionate about data driven problem solving and want to work with technical problems right now but you could see a manager or project manager career in front of you in a few yearsâ time and see this job as a stepping stone in that direction.You have a positive drive with a demonstrated ability to manage and coordinate cross functional projects, keeping a business mind set and customer orientation. You have the ability to adapt your communication to different stakeholders with different perspectives.You have broad experience in modern machine learning techniques and are able to build models independently in several different environments. Given the right data, you are able to build a data model that predicts what percentage of a vehicle population that is at high risk of failure within the next 12 months. You are also able to explain the results to colleagues and top management and put it into a Volvo context.Experience working as a Data Scientist in a consultative selling context is considered a merit.Required Experiences And EducationMaster of Science or equivalent in Engineering, Statistics, Appl. mathematics or Computer Sc.5 years' experience in the field of Data Analytics.Excellent communication skills in English, both spoken and writtenThe position will be based in Lyon, with regular travel expected to other Volvo Group engineering centers, primarily in Sweden but also US, India, Belgium and Poland.If you feel that you are the right person to take on this challenge then please send us your application!For Further Information, Please ContactDaniel Zackrisson, Manager Innovation & Data Analytics Services, +46 31 322 04 85About UsThe Volvo Group is one of the worldâs leading manufacturers of trucks, buses, construction equipment and marine and industrial engines under the leading brands Volvo, Renault Trucks, Mack, UD Trucks, Eicher, SDLG, Terex Trucks, Prevost, Nova Bus, UD Bus and Volvo Penta.Volvo Group Trucks Technologyprovides Volvo Group Trucks and Business Area's with state-of-the-art research, cutting-edge engineering, product planning and purchasing services, as well as aftermarket product support. With Volvo Group Trucks Technology you will be part of a global and diverse team of highly skilled professionals who work with passion, trust each other and embrace change to stay ahead. We make our customers win.Auto req ID101454BREntityGroup Trucks TechnologyState / ProvinceAuvergne-RhÃ´ne-AlpesCity/TownLyonEmployment/Assignment TypeRegularTravel Required (maximum)Occasional TravelFunctional AreaTechnologyLast application date12-Feb-2020

Who we are Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specialising in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing, dedicated to transforming data into business impact across the entire value chain of organisations. We have 1000 employees across 20 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. Thanks to a unique mix of company assets: State of the art data technologies, lean AI agile methodologies for fast delivery, and cohesive teams of the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital experts, all dedicated to bringing extra value to every client. What you will be doing: You will join our Data & Consulting which helps clients transform and improve their marketing strategy by applying advanced analytics to generate value-creating insights from big data and artificial intelligence. Data ScientistParis Area, FranceOnsite clientAre you a motivated professional, passionate about new technologies with a desire to transform the way people do business? Do you enjoy helping customers to enhance their business by applying complex algorithms to large amounts of information? Are you business minded, pro-active, curious and independent? If you enjoy working with statistical models and complex algorithms on diverse business environments then you are the one we are looking for to reinforce our Digital Business Solutions (DBS) team as aData Scientist!Fujitsu DBS is powered by 4 practices â Robotic Process Automation, Artificial Intelligence, Data Analytics and Blockchain. As part of our practice in France, you will be at the forefront of digital, helping our customers make faster, smarter decisions and solve business issues by developing new data driven solutions. Your responsibilities include the design, development, testing and implementation of analytically-informed and issue-based solutions, more precisely by:Collecting and formulating the business requirements & analyzing the customerâs needs
column4: Developing optimization models and algorithms to solve routing problems, logistics planning, scenario simulation, etc
column5: Working with the simulation and modeling of complex scenarios using the MonteCarlo method and other statistical techniques
column6: Building and implement machine learning models and prototype solutions for proof-of-concept
column7: Developing data products and predictive models in collaboration with the developers
column8: Implementing advanced analytical solutions via Big Data Platforms
column9: Relying on evolutionary computing techniques to solve optimization problems
column11: Supporting the customer throughout the entire implementation schedule
column12: Working in close collaboration with the product owner and the customerâs project team
column13: Coaching junior data scientistsYour profileYou have a degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, or Engineering, hands-on experience (minimum 4 years) within the IT and/or consultancy industry and working with data mining techniques, statistics, machine learning and deep learning. You have already worked with Big Data Platforms (such as AWS or Azure) and with Data Visualization tools. You are also familiar with languages such as R, Python, SQL, Matlab andNLP tools.As a person you are curious and independent by nature, you like to combine your technological background to a business environment and enjoy working and interacting on daily basis with clients. On top of that, you have excellent communication skills and focus all efforts on ensuring the customer satisfaction. Next to this you have excellentFrench and Englishlanguage skills.What You Can Expect From UsIt is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, Fujitsu wants to be in the heart/center of our clientsâ digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities. In this changing fast pace environment, we value the work-life balance (flexible working times, home office etc.). You will be able to reinforce your skills with our tailored made training conducted in the classroom, online, or in collaboration with teammates. You will be part of a company promotes diversity, equality and inclusion. We offer you an attractive salary and secondary benefits, including a variable bonus scheme.

Position PurposeWhy Deliveroo?When you first think about Deliveroo, you probably think of getting greatfood to your house in less than half an hour. Awesome right? But behind thescenes is the real story. This story is one of high growth, huge challengesand an enormous opportunity ahead of us. It began with our founder Will,arriving in London over 5 years ago and finding it almost impossible toorder great food, despite the wealth of incredible restaurants in the city.Fast forward 5 years and we operate in 13 countries with over 50,000 riderswho deliver orders from 50,000 restaurants in over 200 cities worldwide.And weâre just getting startedWe want to be the definitive food company - the app you go to any time youhave a hunger pang. We are transforming the way people think about food. Weare already a multi-billion dollar company that is more than doubling insize every year. Deliveroo came top in the FTâsâ list of Europeâsfastest-growing 1000 companies in 2018, and we were the first company everto win Deloitteâs âUK Top 50â two years in a row. Yet most of theextraordinary value this company will generate lies ahead of us.The RoleAs a Data Science Analyst, you will be part of the Strategy Team of theCommercial and Marketing Department. Your mission will consist mainly ofpiloting our strategic projects, modelling complex situations to facilitatedecision-making and supporting teams in complex analyzes. We want toprovide the best possible service to our customers wherever we operate andyou will be a key player in that.Your Responsibilities IncludeData Science Link PointDeliveroo is a company built on Data Science / Big Data analytics. Numerousanalyses are conducted daily by our local teams as well as our Data Scienceteams in London. The role will be to carry out such analyses and create alink with the analyses made by our global teams.Use your analytical skills to improve our business model - identifyingareas for improvement and being proactivePilot strategic projects - you will have a transversal responsibility andwill have to keep a very business-oriented visionIdentify and understand business opportunities - you will modelopportunities and propose an inventory of risks and costs so that we havethe expected returnsSupport the other sales teams - keeping the necessary distance tounderstand which are the most significant levers of actionRequirementsMasters degree in an engineering school/business school / or at universityIdeally, experience in consulting and / or projects related to the supplychain/operationsSpecialization in Data Science or complex analysis experimentsRequired technical knowledge: SQL (necessary), R, Python, JavascriptVery strong analytical skills - able to handle large amounts of data,extract relevant information to identify and solve problemsGood communicator - able to express ideas in a clear and concise way,adapting to the public concernedHighly organized and with a good sense of priorities - able to set up andfollow action plans and follow the "80/20" rule to make quick and effectivedecisionsOpen-minded - curious, able to give and defend his point of view, alignedwith the company's strategyStrategist - able to "think big", share ideas and support the executionOthers: proficiency in English, excellent command of Excel, mastery ofpython / SQL / VBA is highly appreciatedBenefitsThe rare opportunity to change the world such that everyone around you isusing the product you have helped build. We're moving real assets andreinventing the logistics of food deliveryWork in a fun, exciting company culture with people who enjoy what they aredoingBeing part of a team instigating the expansion of a global brandThe opportunity to make an impact and grow with the businessRegular off-sites with the teamOffice lunches once a month and more than enough free food from DeliverooLife at DeliverooWe are a growing team, with a very large impact, seeking to answer some ofthe most interesting questions out there. We move fast, weâre alwayslooking for new ideas and weâre very transparent about the decisions wemake and why we make them. No solution is owned by a particular team, whichmeans the scope for growth and personal impact is enormous.Benefits and DiversityWe believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live inand how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement whenit comes to anyone of the things that make you who you are - your gender,race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you needis a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of thefastest-growing start-ups around.
